column4: if i cant see in my root folder does that mean Im not an admin?
yes it does
well, you may have sudo rights
what are you trying to do?
that is because you don't have root privileges. You need to run the file manager with gksudo.
should I have root priviledges?
if you want to edit stuff... yes. If you don't want to break things, no
you want to run the file manager, nautilus, using gksudo
please note that the system assumes you know what you are doing and does not question completely stupid things done with admin privileges ;-)
for example, someone wanted to free up some space and deleted /tmp...
he thought he "didn't need it"
exactly
or one person changed all the permissions on /etc to 777
that destroyed a system. You hear the funniest things in this channel :-)
my general rule. If you need to use sudo for nautilus, you should be using the cli :-P
Im really new, I barely understand why you mean by that
nm then :-P
groups
linux people are not creative with naming :-P
one exception to being uncreative, the command "less"
how can I get my reg terminal back, since I started nautilus it's not a reg terminal
um... I am afraid to try to explain it... so open a new one :-P
lol, k
unity is the great divider. I haven't upgraded yet ;-)
